data.name: SpecifyMessageBoxOptionsTitle
data.value: Specify MessageBoxOptions

data.name: SpecifyMessageBoxOptionsDescription
data.value: To correctly display a message box for cultures that use a right-to-left reading order, the RightAlign and RtlReading members of the MessageBoxOptions enumeration must be passed to the Show method.

data.name: SpecifyMessageBoxOptionsMessage
data.value: Specify MessageBoxOptions

data.name: AvoidDuplicateAcceleratorsTitle
data.value: Avoid duplicate accelerators

data.name: AvoidDuplicateAcceleratorsDescription
data.value: An access key, also known as an accelerator, enables keyboard access to a control by using the ALT key. When multiple controls have duplicate access keys, the behavior of the access key is not well defined.

data.name: AvoidDuplicateAcceleratorsMessage
data.value: Avoid duplicate accelerators

data.name: SetLocaleForDataTypesTitle
data.value: Set locale for data types

data.name: SetLocaleForDataTypesDescription
data.value: The locale determines culture-specific presentation elements for data, such as formatting that is used for numeric values, currency symbols, and sort order. When you create a DataTable or DataSet, you should explicitly set the locale.

data.name: SetLocaleForDataTypesMessage
data.value: Set locale for data types

data.name: DoNotMarkServicedComponentsWithWebMethodTitle
data.value: Do not mark serviced components with WebMethod

data.name: DoNotMarkServicedComponentsWithWebMethodDescription
data.value: A method in a type that inherits from System.EnterpriseServices.ServicedComponent is marked by using System.Web.Services.WebMethodAttribute. Because WebMethodAttribute and a ServicedComponent method have conflicting behavior and requirements for context and transaction flow, the behavior of the method will be incorrect in some scenarios.

data.name: DoNotMarkServicedComponentsWithWebMethodMessage
data.value: Do not mark serviced components with WebMethod

data.name: ImplementSerializationConstructorsTitle
data.value: Implement serialization constructors

data.name: ImplementSerializationConstructorsDescription
data.value: To fix a violation of this rule, implement the serialization constructor. For a sealed class, make the constructor private; otherwise, make it protected.

data.name: ImplementSerializationConstructorsMessageCreateMagicConstructor
data.value: Add a constructor to {0} with the following signature: 'protected {0}(SerializationInfo info, StreamingContext context)'.

data.name: ImplementSerializationConstructorsMessageMakeUnsealedMagicConstructorFamily
data.value: Declare the serialization constructor of {0}, an unsealed type, as protected.

data.name: ImplementSerializationConstructorsMessageMakeSealedMagicConstructorPrivate
data.value: Declare the serialization constructor of {0}, a sealed type, as private.

data.name: ImplementSerializationConstructorsCodeActionTitle
data.value: Implement Serialization constructor

data.name: MarkWindowsFormsEntryPointsWithStaThreadTitle
data.value: Mark Windows Forms entry points with STAThread

data.name: MarkWindowsFormsEntryPointsWithStaThreadDescription
data.value: STAThreadAttribute indicates that the COM threading model for the application is a single-threaded apartment. This attribute must be present on the entry point of any application that uses Windows Forms; if it is omitted, the Windows components might not work correctly.

data.name: MarkWindowsFormsEntryPointsWithStaThreadMessage
data.value: Mark Windows Forms entry points with STAThread

data.name: MarkAllNonSerializableFieldsTitle
data.value: Mark all non-serializable fields

data.name: MarkAllNonSerializableFieldsDescription
data.value: An instance field of a type that is not serializable is declared in a type that is serializable.

data.name: MarkAllNonSerializableFieldsMessage
data.value: Field {0} is a member of type {1} which is serializable but is of type {2} which is not serializable

data.name: CallBaseClassMethodsOnISerializableTypesTitle
data.value: Call base class methods on ISerializable types

data.name: CallBaseClassMethodsOnISerializableTypesDescription
data.value: To fix a violation of this rule, call the base type GetObjectData method or serialization constructor from the corresponding derived type method or constructor.

data.name: CallBaseClassMethodsOnISerializableTypesMessage
data.value: Call base class methods on ISerializable types

data.name: MarkISerializableTypesWithSerializableTitle
data.value: Mark ISerializable types with serializable

data.name: MarkISerializableTypesWithSerializableDescription
data.value: To be recognized by the common language runtime as serializable, types must be marked by using the SerializableAttribute attribute even when the type uses a custom serialization routine through implementation of the ISerializable interface.

data.name: MarkISerializableTypesWithSerializableMessage
data.value: Add [Serializable] to {0} as this type implements ISerializable

data.name: AddSerializableAttributeCodeActionTitle
data.value: Add Serializable attribute

data.name: AddNonSerializedAttributeCodeActionTitle
data.value: Add the 'NonSerialized' attribute to this field.

data.name: ImplementSerializationMethodsCorrectlyTitle
data.value: Implement serialization methods correctly

data.name: ImplementSerializationMethodsCorrectlyDescription
data.value: A method that handles a serialization event does not have the correct signature, return type, or visibility.

data.name: ImplementSerializationMethodsCorrectlyMessageVisibility
data.value: Because {0} is marked with OnSerializing, OnSerialized, OnDeserializing, or OnDeserialized, change its accessibility to private.

data.name: ImplementSerializationMethodsCorrectlyMessageReturnType
data.value: Because {0} is marked with OnSerializing, OnSerialized, OnDeserializing, or OnDeserialized, change its return type from {1} to void (Sub in Visual Basic).

data.name: ImplementSerializationMethodsCorrectlyMessageParameters
data.value: Because {0} is marked with OnSerializing, OnSerialized, OnDeserializing, or OnDeserialized, change its signature so that it takes a single parameter of type 'System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext'.

data.name: ImplementSerializationMethodsCorrectlyMessageGeneric
data.value: Because {0} is marked with OnSerializing, OnSerialized, OnDeserializing, or OnDeserialized, change its signature so that it is no longer generic.

data.name: ImplementSerializationMethodsCorrectlyMessageStatic
data.value: Because {0} is marked with OnSerializing, OnSerialized, OnDeserializing, or OnDeserialized, change it from static (Shared in Visual Basic) to an instance method.

data.name: ProvideDeserializationMethodsForOptionalFieldsTitle
data.value: Provide deserialization methods for optional fields

data.name: ProvideDeserializationMethodsForOptionalFieldsDescription
data.value: A type has a field that is marked by using the System.Runtime.Serialization.OptionalFieldAttribute attribute, and the type does not provide deserialization event handling methods.

data.name: ProvideDeserializationMethodsForOptionalFieldsMessageOnDeserialized
data.value: Add a 'private void OnDeserialized(StreamingContext)' method to type {0} and attribute it with the System.Runtime.Serialization.OnDeserializedAttribute.

data.name: ProvideDeserializationMethodsForOptionalFieldsMessageOnDeserializing
data.value: Add a 'private void OnDeserializing(StreamingContext)' method to type {0} and attribute it with the System.Runtime.Serialization.OnDeserializingAttribute.

data.name: ImplementISerializableCorrectlyTitle
data.value: Implement ISerializable correctly

data.name: ImplementISerializableCorrectlyDescription
data.value: To fix a violation of this rule, make the GetObjectData method visible and overridable, and make sure that all instance fields are included in the serialization process or explicitly marked by using the NonSerializedAttribute attribute.

data.name: ImplementISerializableCorrectlyMessageDefault
data.value: Add an implementation of GetObjectData to type {0}.

data.name: ImplementISerializableCorrectlyMessageMakeVisible
data.value: Increase the accessibility of {0}.GetObjectData so that it is visible to derived types.

data.name: ImplementISerializableCorrectlyMessageMakeOverridable
data.value: Make {0}.GetObjectData virtual and overridable.

data.name: UseXmlReaderForDataSetReadXmlTitle
data.value: Use XmlReader for DataSet ReadXml

data.name: UseXmlReaderForDataSetReadXmlDescription
data.value: Do not use unsafe overloads of System.Data.DataSet.ReadXml. This API internally enables DTD processing on the XML reader instance used, and uses UrlResolver for resolving external XML entities. The outcome is information disclosure. Content from file system or network shares for the machine processing the XML can be exposed to attacker. In addition, an attacker can use this as a DoS vector.

data.name: UseXmlReaderForDataSetReadXmlMessage
data.value: Use XmlReader for DataSet ReadXml

data.name: UseXmlReaderForDataSetReadXmlSchemaTitle
data.value: Use XmlReader for DataSet ReadXmlSchema

data.name: UseXmlReaderForDataSetReadXmlSchemaDescription
data.value: Do not use unsafe overloads of System.Data.DataSet.ReadXmlSchema. This API internally enables DTD processing on the XML reader instance used, and uses UrlResolver for resolving external XML entities. The outcome is information disclosure. Content from file system or network shares for the machine processing the XML can be exposed to attacker. In addition, an attacker can use this as a DoS vector.

data.name: UseXmlReaderForDataSetReadXmlSchemaMessage
data.value: Use XmlReader for DataSet ReadXmlSchema

data.name: ReviewDataViewCollectionStringTitle
data.value: Review DataView CollectionString

data.name: ReviewDataViewCollectionStringDescription
data.value: Review code to insure that usage of System.Data.DataViewManager.DataViewSettingCollectionString input is sanitized to not contain DTD. Enabling DTD processing on the XML reader and using UrlResolver for resolving external XML entities may lead to information disclosure. Content from file system or network shares for the machine processing the XML can be exposed to attacker. In addition, an attacker can use this as a DoS vector.

data.name: ReviewDataViewCollectionStringMessage
data.value: Review DataView CollectionString

data.name: UseXmlReaderForDataTableReadXmlTitle
data.value: Use XmlReader for DataTable ReadXml

data.name: UseXmlReaderForDataTableReadXmlDescription
data.value: Do not use unsafe overloads of System.Data.DataTable.ReadXml. This API internally enables DTD processing on the XML reader instance used, and uses UrlResolver for resolving external XML entities. The outcome is information disclosure. Content from file system or network shares for the machine processing the XML can be exposed to attacker. In addition, an attacker can use this as a DoS vector.

data.name: UseXmlReaderForDataTableReadXmlMessage
data.value: Use XmlReader for DataTable ReadXml

data.name: UseXmlReaderForDataTableReadXmlSchemaTitle
data.value: Use XmlReader for DataTable ReadXmlSchema

data.name: UseXmlReaderForDataTableReadXmlSchemaDescription
data.value: Checks for usage of an unsafe overload of System.Data.DataTable.ReadXmlSchema. This API internally enables DTD processing on the XML reader instance used, and uses UrlResolver for resolving external XML entities. The outcome is information disclosure. Content from file system or network shares for the machine processing the XML can be exposed to attacker. In addition, an attacker can use this as a DoS vector.

data.name: UseXmlReaderForDataTableReadXmlSchemaMessage
data.value: Use XmlReader for DataTable ReadXmlSchema

data.name: DoNotCatchCorruptedStateExceptions
data.value: Do Not Catch Corrupted State Exceptions

data.name: DoNotCatchCorruptedStateExceptionsDescription
data.value: Catching corrupted state exceptions could mask errors (such as access violations), resulting in inconsistent state of execution or making it easier for attackers to compromise system. Instead, catch and handle a more specific set of exception type(s) or re-throw the exception

data.name: DoNotCatchCorruptedStateExceptionsMessage
data.value: {0} is catching corrupted state exception.

data.name: DoNotUseBrokenCryptographicAlgorithms
data.value: Do Not Use Broken Cryptographic Algorithms

data.name: DoNotUseBrokenCryptographicAlgorithmsDescription
data.value: An attack making it computationally feasible to break this algorithm exists. This allows attackers to break the cryptographic guarantees it is designed to provide. Depending on the type and application of this cryptographic algorithm, this may allow attackers to read enciphered messages, tamper with enciphered messages, forge digital signatures, tamper with hashed content, or otherwise compromise any cryptosystem based on this algorithm. Replace encryption uses with the AES algorithm (AES-256, AES-192 and AES-128 are acceptable) with a key length greater than or equal to 128 bits. Replace hashing uses with a hashing function in the SHA-2 family, such as SHA512, SHA384, or SHA256. Replace digital signature uses with RSA with a key length greater than or equal to 2048-bits, or ECDSA with a key length greater than or equal to 256 bits.

data.name: DoNotUseBrokenCryptographicAlgorithmsMessage
data.value: {0} uses a broken cryptographic algorithm {1}

data.name: DoNotUseWeakCryptographicAlgorithms
data.value: Do Not Use Weak Cryptographic Algorithms

data.name: DoNotUseWeakCryptographicAlgorithmsDescription
data.value: Cryptographic algorithms degrade over time as attacks become for advances to attacker get access to more computation. Depending on the type and application of this cryptographic algorithm, further degradation of the cryptographic strength of it may allow attackers to read enciphered messages, tamper with enciphered messages, forge digital signatures, tamper with hashed content, or otherwise compromise any cryptosystem based on this algorithm. Replace encryption uses with the AES algorithm (AES-256, AES-192 and AES-128 are acceptable) with a key length greater than or equal to 128 bits. Replace hashing uses with a hashing function in the SHA-2 family, such as SHA-2 512, SHA-2 384, or SHA-2 256.

data.name: DoNotUseWeakCryptographicAlgorithmsMessage
data.value: {0} uses a weak cryptographic algorithm {1}

data.name: TypesShouldNotExtendCertainBaseTypesTitle
data.value: Types should not extend certain base types

data.name: TypesShouldNotExtendCertainBaseTypesDescription
data.value: An externally visible type extends certain base types. Use one of the alternatives.

data.name: TypesShouldNotExtendCertainBaseTypesMessageSystemXmlXmlDocument
data.value: Change the base type of {0} so that it no longer extends {1}. The preferred design is to decouple the underlying XmlDocument representation from the type's interface by using containment instead of inheritance.

data.name: TypesShouldNotExtendCertainBaseTypesMessageSystemApplicationException
data.value: Change the base type of {0} so that it no longer extends {1}. This base exception type does not provide any additional value for framework classes. Extend 'System.Exception' or an existing unsealed exception type instead. Do not create a new exception base type unless there is specific value in enabling the creation of a catch handler for an entire class of exceptions.

data.name: TypesShouldNotExtendCertainBaseTypesMessageSystemCollectionsCollectionBase
data.value: Change the base type of {0} from {1} to its generic equivalent 'System.Collections.ObjectModel.Collection'.

data.name: TypesShouldNotExtendCertainBaseTypesMessageSystemCollectionsDictionaryBase
data.value: Change the base type of {0} from {1} to its generic equivalent 'System.Collections.ObjectModel.KeyedCollection'.

data.name: TypesShouldNotExtendCertainBaseTypesMessageSystemCollectionsQueue
data.value: Change the base type of {0} from {1} to its generic equivalent 'System.Collections.Generic.Queue'.

data.name: TypesShouldNotExtendCertainBaseTypesMessageSystemCollectionsReadOnlyCollectionBase
data.value: Change the base type of {0} from {1} to its generic equivalent 'System.Collections.ObjectModel.ReadOnlyCollection'.

data.name: TypesShouldNotExtendCertainBaseTypesMessageSystemCollectionsSortedList
data.value: Change the base type of {0} from {1} to its generic equivalent 'System.Collections.Generic.SortedList'.

data.name: TypesShouldNotExtendCertainBaseTypesMessageSystemCollectionsStack
data.value: Change the base type of {0} from {1} to its generic equivalent 'System.Collections.Generic.Stack'.

data.name: DoNotUseInsecureDTDProcessingDescription
data.value: Using XmlTextReader.Load(), creating an insecure XmlReaderSettings instance when invoking XmlReader.Create(), setting the InnerXml property of the XmlDocument and enabling DTD processing using XmlUrlResolver insecurely can lead to information disclosure. Replace it with a call to the Load() method overload that takes an XmlReader instance, use XmlReader.Create() to accept XmlReaderSettings arguments or consider explicitly setting secure values. The DataViewSettingCollectionString property of DataViewManager should always be assigned from a trusted source, the DtdProcessing property should be set to false, and the XmlResolver property should be changed to XmlSecureResolver or null.

data.name: DoNotUseDtdProcessingOverloadsMessage
data.value: {0} uses unsafe overload of '{1}' method

data.name: DoNotUseDtdProcessingOverloads
data.value: Insecure DTD Processing

data.name: DoNotUseSetInnerXmlMessage
data.value: {0} uses the unsafe setter of InnerXml property of System.Xml.XmlDocument.

data.name: InsecureXmlDtdProcessing
data.value: Insecure DTD processing in XML

data.name: ReviewDtdProcessingPropertiesMessage
data.value: Property in {0} might be set from an untrusted source.

data.name: XmlDocumentWithNoSecureResolverMessage
data.value: In {0} an XmlDocument instance is created without setting its XmlResolver property to a secure value.

data.name: XmlReaderCreateInsecureConstructedMessage
data.value: An insecure XmlReaderSettings instance is provided to XmlReader.Create method.

data.name: XmlReaderCreateInsecureInputMessage
data.value: In {0} a potentially insecure XmlReaderSettings instance is provided to XmlReader.Create method.

data.name: XmlReaderCreateWrongOverloadMessage
data.value: {0} uses an insecure overload of XmlReader.Create which does not accept an XmlReaderSettings argument.

data.name: XmlTextReaderConstructedWithNoSecureResolutionMessage
data.value: {0} creates XmlTextReader instance with insecure default settings.

data.name: XmlTextReaderSetInsecureResolutionMessage
data.value: XmlTextReader instance in {0} is set with insecure values.

data.name: InsecureXsltScriptProcessingMessage
data.value: Insecure XSLT script processing.

data.name: DoNotUseInsecureXSLTScriptExecutionDescription
data.value: Providing an insecure XsltSettings instance and an insecure XmlResolver instance to XslCompiledTransform.Load method is potentially unsafe as it allows processing script within XSL, which on an untrusted XSL input may lead to malicious code execution. Either replace the insecure XsltSettings argument with XsltSettings.Default or an instance that has disabled document function and script execution, or replace the XmlResolver argurment with null or an XmlSecureResolver instance. This message may be suppressed if the input is known to be from a trusted source and external resource resolution from locations that are not known in advance must be supported.

data.name: XslCompiledTransformLoadInsecureConstructedMessage
data.value: In {0} an insecure combination of XsltSettings and XmlResolver instances are provided to XslCompiledTransfor.Load as arguments.

data.name: XslCompiledTransformLoadInsecureInputMessage
data.value: In {0} an insecure combination of XsltSettings and XmlResolver instances are provided to XslCompiledTransfor.Load as arguments.
